thread.title: Oregon shooting victim’s service animal now comforts her finance
thread.title_full: Oregon shooting victim’s service animal now comforts her finance | www.statesman.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: Oregon shooting victim’s service animal now comforts her finance
text:
A gunshot took Sarena Moore’s life. But Bullet also never left her side.
Bullet is Moore’s service animal and was next to her when she was shot and killed by a gunman at Umpqua Community College Oct. 1, according to CNN .
Now Bullet offers comfort to Travis Dow, Moore’s fiancee.
"Bullet became a piece of Sarena,” Dow said to CNN . “And I was happy to get him back."
>> Read more trending stories
Police brought Bullet to Dow the day after Moore was killed, according to CNN .
“(Bullet) has his moments when he’s drooping and everything because he knows she’s been missing,” Dow said to KOIN . “It’s going to be hard. But me and him got the willpower to make it together.”
Bullet now offers comfort to the fiancee of a victim of the Oregon school shooting. Photo Facebook. Posted by Sarena Moore on Friday, July 10, 2015
